verses.verse: Then the Lord<WH3068> said<WH559> to Moses,<WH4872> "Speak<WH559> to the priests,<WH3548> the sons<WH1121> of Aaron,<WH175> and say<WH559> to them, 'No<WH3808> one shall defile<WH2930> himself for a [dead] person<WH5315> among his people,<WH9415>
except<WH3588> <WH518> for his relatives<WH7607> who are nearest<WH7138> to him, his mother<WH517> and his father and his son<WH1> and his daughter<WH1121> and his brother,<WH1323>
also for his virgin<WH1330> sister,<WH269> who is near<WH7138> to him because<WH834> she has<WH1961> had<WH1961> no<WH3808> husband;<WH376> for her he may defile<WH2930> himself.
'He shall not defile<WH2930> himself as a relative<WH1167> by marriage<WH1167> among his people,<WH9415> and so profane<WH2490> himself.

'They shall not make<WH7139> any baldness<WH7139> <WH7144> on their heads,<WH7218> nor<WH3808> shave<WH1548> off<WH1548> the edges<WH6285> of their beards,<WH2206> nor<WH3808> make<WH8295> any cuts<WH8295> in their flesh.<WH1320>

'They shall be holy<WH6918> to their God<WH430> and not profane<WH2490> the name<WH8034> of their God,<WH430> for they present<WH7126> the offerings<WH801> by fire<WH801> to the Lord,<WH3068> the bread<WH3899> of their God;<WH430> so they shall be holy.<WH6944>

'They shall not take<WH3947> a woman<WH802> who is profaned<WH9137> by harlotry,<WH2181> nor<WH3808> shall they take<WH3947> a woman<WH802> divorced<WH1644> from her husband;<WH376> for he is holy<WH6918> to his God.<WH430>

'You shall consecrate<WH6942> him, therefore, for he offers<WH7126> the bread<WH3899> of your God;<WH430> he shall be holy<WH6918> to you; for I the Lord,<WH3068> who sanctifies<WH6942> you, am holy.<WH6918>
'Also the daughter<WH1323> of any<WH376> priest,<WH3548> if<WH3588> she profanes<WH2490> herself by harlotry,<WH2181> she profanes<WH2490> her father; she shall be burned<WH1> with fire.<WH8313>

'And the priest<WH3548> who is the highest<WH1419> among<WH4480> his brothers,<WH251> on whose<WH834> head<WH7218> the anointing<WH4888> oil<WH8081> has been poured,<WH3332> and who has been consecrated<WH4390> <WH3027> to wear<WH3847> the garments,<WH899> shall not uncover<WH6544> his head,<WH7218> nor<WH3808> tear<WH6533> his clothes;<WH899>
nor<WH3808> shall he approach<WH935> any<WH3605> dead<WH4191> person,<WH5315> nor<WH3808> defile<WH2930> himself [even] for his father or his mother;<WH1>

nor<WH3808> shall he go<WH3318> out of the sanctuary,<WH4720> nor<WH3808> profane<WH2490> the sanctuary<WH4720> of his God;<WH430> for the consecration<WH5145> of the anointing<WH4888> oil<WH8081> of his God<WH430> is on him: I am the Lord.<WH3068>
'And he shall take<WH3947> a wife<WH802> in her virginity.<WH1331>

'A widow,<WH490> or a divorced<WH1644> woman, or one who is profaned<WH9137> by harlotry,<WH2181> these<WH428> he may not take;<WH3947> but rather<WH3588> <WH518> he is to marry<WH3947> a virgin<WH1330> of his own people;<WH9415>
that he may not profane<WH2490> his offspring<WH2233> among his people:<WH9415> for I am the Lord<WH3068> who sanctifies<WH6942> him.' "
Then the Lord<WH3068> spoke<WH1696> to Moses,<WH4872> saying,<WH559>

"Speak<WH1696> to Aaron,<WH175> saying,<WH559> 'No<WH3808> man<WH376> of your offspring<WH2233> throughout their generations<WH1755> who<WH834> has<WH1961> a defect<WH9249> shall approach<WH7126> to offer<WH7126> the bread<WH3899> of his God.<WH430>

'For no<WH3808> <WH3605> one<WH376> who<WH834> has a defect<WH9249> shall approach:<WH7126> a blind<WH5787> man,<WH376> or<WH176> a lame<WH6455> man,<WH6455> or<WH176> he who has a disfigured<WH9171> [face], or<WH176> any deformed<WH8311> [limb],
or<WH176> a man<WH376> who<WH834> has<WH1961> a broken<WH7667> foot<WH7272> or<WH176> broken<WH7667> hand,<WH3027>

or<WH176> a hunchback<WH1384> or<WH176> a dwarf,<WH1851> or<WH176> [one who has] a defect<WH8400> in his eye<WH5869> or<WH176> eczema<WH1618> or<WH176> scabs<WH3217> or<WH176> crushed<WH4790> testicles.<WH810>

'No<WH3808> <WH3605> man<WH376> among<WH4480> the descendants<WH2233> of Aaron<WH175> the priest,<WH3548> who<WH834> has a defect,<WH9249> is to come<WH5066> near<WH5066> to offer<WH7126> the Lord's offerings<WH801> by fire;<WH801> [since] he has a defect,<WH9249> he shall not come<WH5066> near<WH5066> to offer<WH7126> the bread<WH3899> of his God.<WH430>
'He may eat<WH398> the bread<WH3899> of his God,<WH430> [both] of the most<WH6944> holy<WH6944> and of the holy,<WH6944>

only<WH389> he shall not go<WH935> in to the veil<WH6532> or come<WH5066> near<WH5066> the altar<WH4196> because<WH3588> he has a defect,<WH9249> that he may not profane<WH2490> My sanctuaries.<WH4720> For I am the Lord<WH3068> who sanctifies<WH6942> them.' "
So Moses<WH4872> spoke<WH1696> to Aaron<WH175> and to his sons<WH1121> and to all<WH3605> the sons<WH1121> of Israel.<WH3478>
